member.name: T:OTAPI.Patcher.Engine.Modifications.Patches.ChangeArchitecture
member.summary: Changes the architecture of the server assembly from x86 to match OTAPI

member.name: M:OTAPI.Callbacks.Terraria.Collision.GetTileCollectionMethod
member.summary:
Gets active ITileCollection instance as it's not available at compile time.
This is because at compile time we are using Terraria.Main.tile which is a 2D array of Terraria.Tile which uses fields. If we compile against fields in OTAPI then our IL wont match after the tile modifications are applied.
member.returns: ITileCollection instance

member.name: T:OTAPI.Tile.DefaultTileCollection
member.summary: Replicates the default functionality of a normal array.

member.name: M:OTAPI.Tile.DefaultTileCollection.GetNewTileCollection
member.summary:
Creates a new 2D array instance of ITile using the default Terraria.Tile implementation.
This cannot be compiled in the OTAPI solution as the Terraria.Tile will not implement ITile at compile time.
member.returns: A 2D ITile array instance

member.name: M:OTAPI.Tile.DefaultTileCollection.#ctor
member.summary: Replicates the default terraria tile array constructor

member.name: M:OTAPI.Tile.DefaultTileCollection.#ctor(OTAPI.Tile.ITile[0:,0:])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance with the specified collection as the underlying source.

member.name: P:OTAPI.Tile.DefaultTileCollection.Item(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Describes the get and set tile accessors that the vanilla server will use

member.name: T:OTAPI.Tile.ITileCollection
member.summary: Describes accessors to a terraria tile collection. This class is injected into the terraria assembly to replace all occurrences of the Terraria.Main.tile array.

member.name: P:OTAPI.Tile.ITileCollection.Item(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Describes the get and set tile accessors that the vanilla server will use

member.name: T:OTAPI.Tile.ITile
member.summary:
ITile is injected into the Terraria assembly to replace all instance usages of Terraria.Tile.
This allows us to seamlessly swap out implementations of the tile mechanism.
member.remarks: This interface is based of the implementations after the Terraria.Tile fields have been changed to properties.

member.name: M:OTAPI.Callbacks.Terraria.Collection.GetNewTileMethod
member.summary:
Creates an ITile instance using the defaul Terraria.Tile constructor.
This cannot be performed at compile time using the OTAPI solution as Terraria.Tile does not implement ITile at compile time.
member.returns: ITile instance

member.name: M:OTAPI.Callbacks.Terraria.Collection.GetNewTileFromMethod
member.summary:
Creates an ITile instance using the defaul Terraria.Tile constructor.
This cannot be performed at compile time using the OTAPI solution as Terraria.Tile does not implement ITile at compile time.
member.returns: ITile instance

member.name: M:OTAPI.Callbacks.Terraria.Collection.CreateTile
member.summary:
Replaces all Terraria.Tile initialisation calls in the terraria assembly.
If null is returned from the handler, a default Terraria.Tile instance will be created.
member.returns: An instance of ITile

member.name: M:OTAPI.Callbacks.Terraria.Collection.CreateTile(OTAPI.Tile.ITile)
member.summary:
Replaces all Terraria.Tile initialisation calls in the terraria assembly.
If null is returned from the handler, a default Terraria.Tile instance will be created.
member.returns: An instance of ITile

member.name: F:OTAPI.Hooks.Tile.CreateCollection
member.summary: Occurs on the static constructor of Terraria.Main when the Terraria.Main.tile field is being initialised. Use this to create custom tile providers.

member.name: F:OTAPI.Hooks.Tile.CreateTile
member.summary: Occurs whenever a tile instance is to be created in the Terraria assembly.

member.name: F:OTAPI.Hooks.Tile.CreateTileFrom
member.summary: Occurs whenever a tile instance is to be created in the Terraria assembly.

member.name: T:OTAPI.Modification.Tile.Modifications.TileConstructor
member.summary: This modification is used to move all tile property/field updates from the constructor out into a virtual Initialise method. This gives consumers more control over the default tile mechanism.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2.Dot(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2)
member.summary: Calculates the dot product of two vectors. If the two vectors are unit vectors, the dot product returns a floating point value between -1 and 1 that can be used to determine some properties of the angle between two vectors. For example, it can show whether the vectors are orthogonal, parallel, or have an acute or obtuse angle between them.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2.Dot(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Calculates the dot product of two vectors and writes the result to a user-specified variable. If the two vectors are unit vectors, the dot product returns a floating point value between -1 and 1 that can be used to determine some properties of the angle between two vectors. For example, it can show whether the vectors are orthogonal, parallel, or have an acute or obtuse angle between them.
member.param: [OutAttribute] The dot product of the two vectors.

member.name: T:OTAPI.IEntity
member.summary: IEntity is designed to be the base of all entities in the application. Said examples of these entities may be: Command line sender TerrariaEntity (which is Projectiles, Players, Npcs etc) External assembly's implementation defined in an external assembly.

member.name: T:OTAPI.TerrariaEntity
member.summary: TerrariaEntity is intended to be the inclusive base of all vanilla terraria entities, so will be used instead of the patcher injecting IEntity.
member.remarks: Developers: We must ensure we don't introduce new requirements that conflict with: Terraria.Player Terraria.NPC Terraria.Projectile

member.name: T:OTAPI.Modifications.Mono.Modifications.HandlePlatformIO
member.summary:
Since we use the Windows TerrariaServer.exe we need to handle windows specific code In this case we need to replace all calls to 'FileOperationAPIWrapper.MoveToRecycleBin' and redirect them to our own callback that will handle mono+.net
UPDATE: This PInvoke is apparently quite broken on .net core, so I have decided to remove it for all platforms. - Kevin

member.name: T:OTAPI.Modifications.Mono.Modifications.RemoveConsoleCtrlCheck
member.summary:
Mono does not like the SetConsoleCtrlHandler method that terraria uses for its server. This modification will remove the call to this method, allowing mono to continue.
Alternatively we could have used , but we would then have to implement the assembly resolving (at least while terraria still contains embedded assemblies)

member.name: M:OTAPI.Callbacks.Terraria.WorldGen.GetTileCollectionMethod
member.summary:
Gets active ITileCollection instance as it's not available at compile time.
This is because at compile time we are using Terraria.Main.tile which is a 2D array of Terraria.Tile which uses fields. If we compile against fields in OTAPI then our IL wont match after the tile modifications are applied.
member.returns: ITileCollection instance
